attributes.additional_details:
I have spoken to some mums and most of them complain about the cost of childcare. 
85% will rather stay home to take care of the kids, because they can't afford the child care.
79% really want to go back to work, if there is more flexible job roles that can suit their lifestyle (dropping and picking the kids from school)
attributes.background:
Most mum's struggle to fit into the work system after having kids, especially in the corporate world! So I am proposing a more flexible time for mums, so they can have a work-life balance and earn a living too. 
They can work on a part- time basis. Starting from 10am to 2pm./2.30pm.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition in its current form as it does not call for a clear action from the UK Government and Parliament. There is already a legal right for people to request flexible working from their employer. 

If you want the law to be changed, to require employers to agree to any request from a mum for flexible working, you could start a new petition calling for that.
